intro: Malvastrum tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Tweedy's mallow is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
